ReportSection.name: Description
ReportSection.title:
Conference Program at AGE-WELL 2023
Shaping the Future of Healthy Aging
ReportSection.Static:
Join us in Toronto, ON for the AGE-WELL Annual Conference: Shaping the Future of Healthy Aging! Sessions are designed to maximize networking and knowledge exchange amongst network stakeholders. There are four program options available to showcase your work: symposia, workshops, posters, demos.

Submission Information

The theme of the 2023 conference is Shaping the future of healthy aging. Individuals are encouraged to submit abstracts which address this theme with a focus on technology-enabled solutions. Solutions in the AGE-WELL context may include a technology itself or a service, policy or practice related to technology and aging.

Abstracts may be submitted for poster, symposium, workshop or demo presentations. Proposals must be submitted by August 4, 2023.The instructions for submitting an abstract are detailed in the sections below.

Who May Submit

Submissions are encouraged from all stakeholders who work or have an interest in technology and aging or ‘AgeTech”. Submitters do not need to be current members of AGE-WELL (e.g. funded or affiliate researcher, HQP, startup affiliate, etc.).

Abstract Acceptance

The abstract submitter (the person who submits the abstract, whether or not an author on the abstract) will be informed of the status (accepted/rejected) of their submission as soon as possible after reviews are completed. Accepted authors will be advised of registration deadlines to confirm places in the program at that time.

All individuals attending the conference (including presenters) will be required to register and pay the registration fee.

Questions about conference applications can be directed to conference@agewell-nce.ca.

Abstract Deadline (all session types): Friday August 4, 2023

Please contact conference@agewell-nce.ca for any questions.

ReportSection.name: Symposia
ReportSection.title: Symposia
ReportSection.Static:
AGE-WELL 2023 will feature symposia as part of concurrent programming on both Wednesday, October 25 and Thursday, October 26. A symposium is a collection of papers / presentations contributed by a group of individuals, usually from different institutions/organizations, on a single theme. Each participant gives a presentation relevant to the theme. The chair leads the symposium and discusses the papers as they relate to each other and the overall topic. Researchers are encouraged to co-present with a partner, older adult or caregiver involved in their project. Chairs are encouraged to ensure multiple perspectives are represented to foster an inclusive approach and lively discussion. Symposia chairs are encouraged to include presenters from outside AGE-WELL, where appropriate, or as required by their chosen topic.

Symposia are 90-minute sessions allowing for presentation and discussion.

The symposium proposal must be submitted by the deadline below; attached abstracts for individual presentations comprising the symposium may be submitted after the deadline.

If you are interested in contributing to a symposium under development by someone else, please submit a brief description of the research you would like considered for inclusion to conference@agewell-nce.ca instead of submitting an abstract through Forum. Please include title of your work, AGE-WELL Challenge Area, as well as proposed presenter name and contact email with the Subject heading “Challenge Area Symposium”.

ReportItem.options: CA1 - Supportive Homes & Communities|CA2 - Health Care & Health Service Delivery|CA3 - Autonomy & Independence|CA4 - Cognitive Health & Dementia|CA5 - Mobility & Transportation|CA6 - Healthy Lifestyles & Wellness|CA7 - Staying Connected|CA8 - Financial Wellness & Employment
I would like to apply for this session

ReportSection.name: Workshops
ReportSection.title: Workshops (2-4)
ReportSection.Static:
Workshops are informal seminars that allow for the demonstration and application of techniques and skills. These are 90-minute sessions allowing for in-depth presentation and discussion.

Workshop abstract submissions are not to exceed 250 words. They should include the following information: a) title of workshop b) statement of purpose and objectives c) workshop format (e.g., interactive process), d) anticipated learning outcomes. Workshops must be interactive.

ReportItem.options: CA1 - Supportive Homes & Communities|CA2 - Health Care & Health Service Delivery|CA3 - Autonomy & Independence|CA4 - Cognitive Health & Dementia|CA5 - Mobility & Transportation|CA6 - Healthy Lifestyles & Wellness|CA7 - Staying Connected|CA8 - Financial Wellness & Employment
I would like to apply for this session

ReportSection.name: Poster Sessions
ReportSection.title: Poster Sessions
ReportSection.Static:
AGE-WELL 2023 will feature multiple poster sessions open to all network participants on Wednesday October 25 and Thursday October 26. Only one poster per project / individual is permitted. Posters with HQP first authors will automatically be entered in our poster competition. The Poster Session is a display presentation. Material is mounted on a poster board, which is staffed by the author (this is mandatory) for a designated period of time. Abstracts must be informational and must report on work completed.

Abstracts are not to exceed 250 words and should include the following information: a) full author details, b) a short statement of the objectives c) method d) results e) conclusions

ReportItem.options: poster is first authored and presented by an HQP

ReportSection.name: Drinks & Demos
ReportSection.title: Drinks & Demos
ReportSection.Static:
AGE-WELL 2023 will feature our popular “Drinks & Demos” within AgeTech Innovation Week receptions on the evenings of Tuesday, October 24 and Wednesday, October 25.  Accepted demos will be scheduled on one of the two reception days to permit maximum participation. This is a free demo option reserved for pre-commercial technologies, knowledge mobilization products such as toolkits, websites etc.

Note that AGE-WELL 2023 will also include a paid exhibits hall spanning October 24-26 requiring separate application. Discounts are available for AGE-WELL startup affiliates in the Emerging Innovation Zone of the exhibits hall.

Abstracts are not to exceed 250 words and should include a detailed description of the demo and demo and demo set-up (a 3 x 6 table and chairs will be provided). Monitors and electrical may be provided on request and subject to availability.
